paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted variants in the KCNH2 gene along with penetrance data from the study on Long QT syndrome in a Swedish cohort.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Evaluation of the pathogenicity in seven of the novel mutations was straightforward, including two stop mutations (KCNQ1 p.R594*, and KCNH2 p.A79Dfs*63).

functional_data.summary: The mutation is predicted to result in a frameshift leading to a premature stop codon.

variants.additional_notes: This variant was identified as a novel mutation unique to the cohort.
key_quotes: Evaluation of the pathogenicity in seven of the novel mutations was straightforward, including two stop mutations (KCNQ1 p.R594*, and KCNH2 p.A79Dfs*63).

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Evaluation of the pathogenicity in seven of the novel mutations was straightforward, including two frame-shift mutations resulting in premature stops (KCNH2 p.A79Dfs*63, and KCNH2 p.D287Gfs*47).

functional_data.summary: The mutation is predicted to result in a frameshift leading to a premature stop codon.

variants.additional_notes: This variant was identified as a novel mutation unique to the cohort.
key_quotes: Evaluation of the pathogenicity in seven of the novel mutations was straightforward, including two frame-shift mutations resulting in premature stops (KCNH2 p.A79Dfs*63, and KCNH2 p.D287Gfs*47).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding KCNH2 variants were extracted successfully.
